page.title: 08Attractions in Warton
page.content: The area is designated as one of outstanding beauty with many upland, lowland and woodland walks. Besides fossil hunters, the crag draws those who enjoy a modest climb, panoramic views, picnics or wild fruits. The church with its Washington links has many points of interest with a well-kept rectory ruin nearby. A quarry car park attracts rock climbing schools for basic training. Listed homes cover 4OO years of village life. A small Interior Design store, until recently a Coop, draws from 5 counties and delivers overseas. Nearby Leighton Park with its Hall & Gillow furniture, has a display of live eagles, falcons and owls. A Marina is a future possibility at Dock Acres gravel lake where recent workings revealed a Roman Dock. Stock Car racing is held on the shore.
